item.title: Speed Camera Sign going to Apperley needed for Enforcement, 23rd November
item.description:
Speed Camera Sign going to Apperley needed for Enforcement. David Holland confirm B4213 will now have the speed van on it. According I believe that a Camera Sign and Speed Sign is needed at this location to allow penalty notices to be (more) successfully prosecuted, to avoid technicalities.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Missing Sign for junction on Bend and 30mpg!, 23rd November
item.description:
The "Junction on the outside of a bend ahead" sign has long since disappeared, and sadly drivers at 50mpg OR MORE! regularly drive straight on to the Deerhurst Single Track Road not realising the main road bends left. If traffic is coming the other way there is NO TIME TO stop as the bend means YOU CANNOT see the mistake the onward traffic may have made!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Deerhurst Walton sign too small and misplaced - bent, 23rd November
item.description:
Deerhurst Walton sign too small and misplaced, on B4213. This sign needs to be suitable to inform 50mpg traffic that there is a road junction, especially in low light and at night. Also the Location means the sign is regularly hit by speeding vans and/or lorries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Clsed Sign obstructed, 23rd November
item.description:
The permanent Road Closed flip sign is obstructed by vegetation & a large 4x4 which is parked on the householders driveway. This sign is sited in a poor location and is easily missed by motorists who turn onto the lane. As this is the only warning sign along the lane before vehicles encounter flooding past the Red Lion Inn many miss it only to find out it’s too late when they’re in over 2ft of flood waters. The sign is in desperate need of being repositioned to a site which is more visible to motorists turning onto the lane. On the evening of 17/11/2025 numerous motorists missed seeing this sign & as there was no temporary signs deployed further along the lane at this time at least four ploughed into flood waters over 2ft deep after the river Chelt. Improvements regarding signage & depth of waters are required along the entirety of the lane. How many more motorists will miss the sign & continue along the lane, hit the flood waters before there’s a fatality?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
